profile_positions.description: Subject Matter Expert (SME) in Cell Based and (q)PCR Based Assays for Late Stage Development Programs of Biologics and Vaccins
profile_positions.title: Associate Principal Scientist BVA-Oss

profile_positions.description:
Head of the section Quality Control & Analytical Development and Validation In Vitro Pharmacology in the department MSD Pharmaceutical Operations QC Microbiology & Pharmacology.
Responsible for:
QC operations in the areas of: Biological activity (pharmacology), Residual DNA, Micobiological identification, Endotoxin, Mycoplasma.
Development and validation in the areas of:  Biological activity (pharmacology) and Residual DNA (molecular biology). These activities include: Method validation (from R&D to GMP), Biological Critical Reagent Qualification, Method Transfers to Internal Laboratories and Contract Laboratories, Consultancy in method implementation and improvement, regulatory issues, and trouble shooting/Root cause analysis
profile_positions.title: Team Lead Quality Control In Vitro Pharmacology

company.name: The Janssen Prevention Center - The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description:
Head of the Small Molecule Discovery Team within the Preventive Interventions Platform of the Janssen Prevention Center. 
Early drug discovery with a strong focus on the prevention of non-communicable diseases that come with age, including many types of cancer, cardiovascular disease, metabolic disorders and neurodegenerative illnesses. The Preventive Intervention Platform explores novel molecular approaches to intervene in a very early (pre-symptomatic) stage of disease.
Activities include: target identification, target validation, assay development, lead finding, lead optimization and unraveling the molecular mechanism of action.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist Biological Assays

profile_positions.location: Leiden Academic Centre for Drug Research
profile_positions.description: Responsible for the molecular pharmacology and biochemical laboratories within the Division and daily supervision of 6 PhD-students, 2 postdocs, and 2 technicians. The projects under my supervision include close collaborations with (inter)national pharmaceutical companies and academic research groups.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Novo Nordisk Foundation Center for Basic Metabolic Research (NNF CBMR)
Department for Receptology and Enteroendocrinology
Copenhagen University
In collaboration with:
Leiden Academic Centre for Drug Research (LACDR)
Division of Medicinal Chemistry
Leiden University

Elucidation of function and activation of G protein-coupled receptors involved in the enteroendocrine system, including the rather unexplored adhesion-GPCRs.

In 2012, I initiated the Dutch-Danish alliance, a close collaboration between the Department of Medicinal Chemistry, Leiden and the Department of Receptology and Endocrinology, Copenhagen. In the spirit of this alliance, I have been conducting my research in Leiden since October 2012. 
My research has since focussed entirely on the structure and function of the full orphan adhesion GPCRs ADGRG2 (GPR64) and ADGRG4 (GPR112). My research has been of high importance in acquiring the NNF Challenge Grant: “Novel Targets in the Prevention and Treatment of Diabetes and Obesity” in 2015.
profile_positions.title: Post-doc

profile_positions.description:
Leiden/Amsterdam Center for Drug Research
Division of Medicinal Chemistry
Part of a Top Institute Pharma project

Thermostability of G protein-coupled receptors. The project aims to develop a method that enables fast identification of mutant receptors with increased bio-stability. This research will be continued as part of a project that was recently rewarded a prestigious NWO-TOP grant.
profile_positions.title: Post-Doc

profile_positions.description:
Leiden/Amsterdam Center for Drug Research
Division of Medicinal Chemistry
Part of a Top Institute Pharma project

Thesis titel: Activation of G protein-coupled receptors - The role of extracellular loops in adenosine receptors

My achievements included setting up a new method for screening inactivating mutant receptors using an S. Cerevisiae expression system, establishing a radioligand binding assay on whole yeast cells expressing adenosine receptors. I have created hundreds of mutant receptors using a wide variety of mutagenesis approaches. This large number of mutations has taught us a lot about the structure and activation of class A GPCRs, in particular the adenosine receptors.
profile_positions.title: PhD-student

profile_positions.description:
Assay development

Development of a novel reporter gene assay for investigation of ligand directed signalling of a class C GPCR.

Literature thesis titel: The gamma-hydroxybutyrate receptor as part of the tetraspanin web
profile_positions.title: Master student

profile_positions.description:
Department of Human Genetics, Molecular Genetics

Exploring the CRB1-complex using yeast-two-hybrid screening. CRB1 is a transmembrane protein involved in Retinitis Pigmentosa. During this internship, I identified a new member of the CRB1-complex that directly interacts with the protein MPP5. This protein, syntenin, connects the complex with the cytoskeleton and may be a new target protein for Retinitis Pigmentosa and other eye disorders. 

Literature thesis titel: Vascularization of the retina: it all comes down to VEGF
profile_positions.title: Master student

profile_positions.description: Exploring 2D SDS-PAGE as a diagnostic tool for genetic mitochondrial disorders
